history.proof: intros f g x exf exg. destruct exf as [lf isdf]. destruct exg as [lg isdg]. exists (plus lf lg). apply is_derive_plus with (df := lf) (dg := lg); auto.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K

Goal:
forall (f g : K -> V) (x : K), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : K => plus (f x0) (g x0)) x

Premises:
plus = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.plus G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
f = fun f : family => let (ind, f0, _) := f in f0 : family -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope R_scope] f is a coercion
ex_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) => exists l : V, is_derive f x l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
is_derive_plus : forall (f g : K -> V) (x : K) (df dg : V), is_derive f x df -> is_derive g x dg -> is_derive (fun x0 : K => plus (f x0) (g x0)) x (plus df dg)
ex_derive_opp : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive (fun x0 : ?K => opp (f x0)) x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), locally x (fun t : ?K => f t = g t) -> ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_ext : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), (forall t : ?K, f t = g t) -> ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
continuous_plus : forall (f g : ?U -> ?V) (x : ?U), continuous f x -> continuous g x -> continuous (fun x0 : ?U => plus (f x0) (g x0)) x where ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- UniformSpace] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_Reals_1 : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), derivable_pt f x -> ex_derive f x
ex_derive_Reals_0 : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), ex_derive f x -> derivable_pt f x
Derive_correct : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive f x -> is_derive f x (Derive f x)
ex_derive_continuous : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x -> continuous f x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_equiv = fun (T : Type) (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (f g : T -> V) => is_domin F g (fun x : T => minus (g x) (f x)) : forall (T : Type) (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (T -> V) -> (T -> V) -> Prop Arguments T, K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope]
filterdiff_mult_fct : forall (f g : ?U -> ?K) (x : ?U) (lf lg : ?U -> ?K), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> filterdiff f (locally x) lf -> filterdiff g (locally x) lg -> filterdiff (fun t : ?U => mult (f t) (g t)) (locally x) (fun t : ?U => plus (mult (lf t) (g x)) (mult (f x) (lg t))) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_derive_filterdiff : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K), ex_derive f x < -> ex_filterdiff f (locally x) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), locally x (fun t : ?K => f t = g t) -> is_derive f x l -> is_derive g x l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive_opp : forall (f : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), is_derive f x l -> is_derive (fun x0 : ?K => opp (f x0)) x (opp l) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_filterdiff_mult_fct : forall (f g : ?U -> ?K) (x : ?U), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> ex_filterdiff f (locally x) -> ex_filterdiff g (locally x) -> ex_filterdiff (fun t : ?U => mult (f t) (g t)) (locally x) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
is_derive_ext : forall (f g : ?K -> ?V) (x : ?K) (l : ?V), (forall t : ?K, f t = g t) -> is_derive f x l -> is_derive g x l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
filterdiff_comp' : forall (f : ?U -> ?V) (g : ?V -> ?W) (x : ?U) (lf : ?U -> ?V) (lg : ?V -> ?W), filterdiff f (locally x) lf -> filterdiff g (locally (f x)) lg -> filterdiff (fun y : ?U => g (f y)) (locally x) (fun y : ?U => lg (lf y)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?W : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
filterdiff_scal_fct : forall (x : ?U) (f : ?U -> ?K) (g : ?U -> ?V) (lf : ?U -> AbsRing_NormedModule ?K) (lg : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> filterdiff f (locally x) lf -> filterdiff g (locally x) lg -> filterdiff (fun t : ?U => scal (f t) (g t)) (locally x) (fun t : ?U => plus (scal (lf t) (g x)) (scal (f x) (lg t))) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
filterdiff_ext_locally : forall (f g : ?U -> ?V) (x : ?U) (l : ?U -> ?V), locally x (fun y : ?U => f y = g y) -> filterdiff f (locally x) l -> filterdiff g (locally x) l where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
ex_filterdiff_plus_fct : forall f g : ?U -> ?V, ex_filterdiff f ?F -> ex_filterdiff g ?F -> ex_filterdiff (fun u : ?U => plus (f u) (g u)) ?F where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
filterdiff_plus_fct : forall f g lf lg : ?U -> ?V, filterdiff f ?F lf -> filterdiff g ?F lg -> filterdiff (fun u : ?U => plus (f u) (g u)) ?F (fun u : ?U => plus (lf u) (lg u)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
ex_filterdiff_scal_fct : forall (x : ?U) (f : ?U -> ?K) (g : ?U -> ?V), (forall n m : ?K, mult n m = mult m n) -> ex_filterdiff f (locally x) -> ex_filterdiff g (locally x) -> ex_filterdiff (fun t : ?U => scal (f t) (g t)) (locally x) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K]
equiv_carac_1 : forall f g o : ?T -> ?V, (forall x : ?T, f x = plus (g x) (o x)) -> is_domin ?F g o -> is_equiv ?F f g where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Type] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
filterdiff_comp'_2 : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (g : ?T -> ?V) (h : ?U -> ?V -> ?W) (x : ?T) (lf : ?T -> ?U) (lg : ?T -> ?V) (lh : ?U -> ?V -> ?W), filterdiff f (locally x) lf -> filterdiff g (locally x) lg -> filterdiff (fun t : prod_NormedModule ?K ?U ?V => h (fst t) (snd t)) (locally (f x, g x)) (fun t : prod_NormedModule ?K ?U ?V => lh (fst t) (snd t)) -> filterdiff (fun y : ?T => h (f y) (g y)) (locally x) (fun y : ?T => lh (lf y) (lg y)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?T :...
filterdiff_comp : forall (f : ?U -> ?V) (g : ?V -> ?W) (lf : ?U -> ?V) (lg : ?V -> ?W), filterdiff f ?F lf -> filterdiff g (filtermap f ?F) lg -> filterdiff (fun y : ?U => g (f y)) ?F (fun y : ?U => lg (lf y)) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?U : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?W : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
equiv_carac_0 : forall f g : ?T -> ?V, is_equiv ?F f g -> {o : ?T -> ?V | (forall x : ?T, f x = plus (g x) (o x)) /\ is_domin ?F g o} where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Type] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
is_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) (l : V) => filterdiff f (locally x) (fun y : K => scal y l) : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> V -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _ _]
filterdiff_iter_plus_fct : forall (l : list ?I) (f df : ?I -> ?U -> ?V), ?U -> (forall j : ?I, List.In j l -> filterdiff (f j) ?F (df j)) ->...-> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
filterdiff_comp_2 : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (g : ?T -> ?V) (h : ?U -> ?V -> ?W) (lf : ?T -> ?U) (lg : ?T -> ?V) (lh : ?U -> ?V -> ?W), filterdiff f ?F lf -> filterdiff g ?F lg -> filterdiff (fun t : prod_NormedModule ?K ?U ?V => h (fst t) (snd t)) (filtermap (fun t : ?T => (f t, g t)) ?F) (fun t : prod_NormedModule ?K ?U ?V => lh (fst t) (snd t)) ->...-> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]
equiv_ext_loc : forall f g : ?T -> ?V, ?F (fun x : ?T => f x = g x) -> is_equiv ?F f g where ?T : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Type] ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- NormedModule ?K] ?F : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Filter ?F]

```coq
intros f g x exf exg.
destruct exf as [lf isdf].
destruct exg as [lg isdg].
exists (plus lf lg).
apply is_derive_plus with (df := lf) (dg := lg); assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros f g x exf exg. destruct exf as [lf isdf]. destruct exg as [lg isdg]. exists (plus lf lg). apply is_derive_plus with (df := lf) (dg := lg); auto.
